metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0204 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap overflow vulnerability was found in bluez in versions prior to 5.63. An attacker with local network access could pass specially crafted files causing an application to halt or crash, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0204` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3+esm2
bluez - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3+esm2
bluez-cups - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3+esm2
bluez-hcidump - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3+esm2
bluez-obexd - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3+esm2
bluez-tests - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3+esm2
libbluetooth3 - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bluez package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.37-0ubuntu5.3+esm2').
